title: The Cook Undergraduate Research Journal Volume 3 Spring 2026
creator: Brenna Hawkins; Katrina Beall; Steve Lemeshko; Alexandra Stith; Alexa Benitez
description: The third volume of CURJ, a scholarly platform dedicated to the dispersion of cutting-edge research and innovative perspectives within the field of political science. Contains the articles: Trumpism as a Catalyst for Conspiratorial Thinking; Belief in Disenfranchisement as a Driver of Political Violence; Political-Environmental Violence Nexus in Russia's Informational Autocracy; Social Trust and Political Violence: The Effect of Group Influence on Political Behavior; How Many Do You See?
publisher: Department of Politics and Philosophy, University of Idaho
source: Department of Politics and Philosophy, University of Idaho
rights: In copyright, educational use permitted. Educational use includes non-commercial reproduction of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. For other contexts beyond fair use, including digital reproduction, please contact the University of Idaho Department of Politics and Philosophy, https://www.uidaho.edu/letters-arts-social-sciences/academics/politics-philosophy

title: The Cook Undergraduate Research Journal Volume 1 Spring 2025
creator: Nolan Kelly; Martha Smith; Jacob Bindley; Gage Purdom
description: The second volume of CURJ, a scholarly platform dedicated to the dispersion of cutting-edge research and innovative perspectives within the field of political science. Contains the articles: The Outcomes of Truth and Justice Processes on Contemporary Democracy in Argentina and Brazil; Property Tax Implication on Levy Passage Rates in Idaho; Grassroots Campaigns and the Election of the 2020 U.S. House; Patriotism and Crime: A Study on how US Patriots Affect Crime.
publisher: Department of Politics and Philosophy, University of Idaho
source: Department of Politics and Philosophy, University of Idaho
rights: In copyright, educational use permitted. Educational use includes non-commercial reproduction of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. title: The Cook Undergraduate Research Journal Volume 1 Spring 2024
creator: Claryssa Baker; Thomas Garcia Jr.; Flick Kemp; Sydney Sterling
description: The first volume of CURJ, a scholarly platform dedicated to the dispersion of cutting-edge research and innovative perspectives within the field of political science. Contains the articles: Religiosity, Income, and Political Violence; Restricted Driver's Licenses and their Effects on Deportations; American Antitrust Policies: A Retrospective Analysis; The Effect of Body-Worn Cameras on State Conviction Rates.
